verbose_text: To rule out synaptic effects, we replicated these findings in the presence of iGluR antagonists (20 muM CNQX and 20 muM CPP); BDNF increased EB neuron excitability (iGluR antagonists = 4.0 +/- 2.1 vs. BDNF = 8.4 +/- 4.2 spikes; n = 10; paired t-test, P < 0.05) and decreased excitability of LB neurons (iGluR antagonists = 12.9 +/- 2.9 vs. BDNF = 6.5 +/- 2.15 spikes; n = 11; paired t-test, P < 0.001).
